trans-unit.source: Many developers think that arrow function makes your syntax shorter, simpler and thus makes your code readable.
trans-unit.target: 许多开发人员认为，箭头功能使您的语法更短，更简单，从而使您的代码更具可读性。

trans-unit.source: ALL functions have an implicit parameter called this. How this is set when calling a function depends on how that function is called.
trans-unit.target: 所有函数都有一个称为 this 的隐式参数。调用函数时如何设置 this 值取决于该函数的调用方式。

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: 例如：

trans-unit.source: This is an arrow function. Arrow functions are a short syntax, introduced by ECMAscript 6, that can be used similarly to the way you would use function expressions. In other words, you can often use them in place of expressions like function (foo) {...}. But they have some important differences. For example, they do not bind their own values of this (see below for discussion).
trans-unit.target: 这是一个箭头功能。箭头函数是ECMAscript 6引入的一种短语法，可以与使用函数表达式的方式类似地使用。换句话说，您经常可以使用它们代替诸如 function (foo) {...} 类的表达式。但是它们有一些重要的区别。例如，它们不与他们的自身价值 this （见下面的讨论）。

trans-unit.source: A Note on How this Works in Arrow Functions
trans-unit.target: 关于如何注意 this 在箭厂的功能

trans-unit.source: A problem comes up when you want to use a function as a callback or a listener. You make class and want to assign a function as the callback that accesses an instance of the class.
trans-unit.target: 当你想把一个函数作为回调或监听器时,就会出现一个问题。你做了类,并希望指定一个函数作为回调函数来访问该类的一个实例。

trans-unit.source: Additional information on Arrow Functions can be found here.
trans-unit.target: 可以在此处找到有关箭头功能的更多信息。

trans-unit.source: Additional up-to-date information can be found on browser compatibility here
trans-unit.target: 可以在此处找到有关浏览器兼容性的其他最新信息。

trans-unit.source: Also known as Fat Arrow Functions. They're a clean and consise way to write function expressions, e.g. function() {}.
trans-unit.target: 也称为胖箭头功能。它们是编写函数表达式的简洁方法，例如 function() {} 。

trans-unit.source: An ArrowFunction does not define local bindings for arguments, super, this, or new.target. Any reference to arguments, super, this, or new.target within an ArrowFunction must resolve to a binding in a lexically enclosing environment. Typically this will be the Function Environment of an immediately enclosing function.
trans-unit.target: 一个ArrowFunction没有定义本地绑定 arguments ， super ， this 或 new.target 。任何引用 arguments ， super ， this 或 new.target 内的ArrowFunction必须下定决心，在词法封闭环境中的绑定。通常，这将是立即封闭函数的函数环境。

trans-unit.source: An arrow function expression (also known as fat arrow function) has a shorter syntax compared to function expressions and lexically binds the this value (does not bind its own this, arguments, super, or new.target). Arrow functions are always anonymous. These function expressions are best suited for non-method functions and they can not be used as constructors.
trans-unit.target: 相比箭头函数表达式（也称为脂肪箭头功能）具有更短的语法函数表达式和词法结合 this 值（不结合其自身的 this ， arguments ， super 或 new.target ）。箭头功能始终是匿名的。这些函数表达式最适合非方法函数，因此不能用作构造函数。

trans-unit.source: An arrow function expression has a shorter syntax compared to function expressions and lexically binds the this value. Arrow functions are always anonymous.
trans-unit.target: 与函数表达式相比,箭头函数表达式具有较短的语法,并在词法上绑定了这个值。箭头函数始终是匿名的。

trans-unit.source: An arrow function... lexically binds the this value (does not bind its own this...)
trans-unit.target: 箭头函数...按词法绑定 this 值（不绑定自身的 this ...）

trans-unit.source: Android Browser (v. 47+)
trans-unit.target: 安卓浏览器 (v.47+)

trans-unit.source: Android Browser: 56+
trans-unit.target: 安卓浏览器。56+

trans-unit.source: Arrow Functions can remove the need of function, return and {} when defining functions. They are one-liners, similar to Lambda Expressions in Java or Python.
trans-unit.target: 定义函数时，箭头函数可以消除对 function ， return 和 {} 的需要。它们是一排，类似于Java或Python中的Lambda表达式。

trans-unit.source: Arrow functions are part of the ECMAscript 6 specification. They are not yet supported in all browsers, but they are partially or fully supported in Node v. 4.0+ and in most modern browsers in use as of 2018. (I’ve included a partial list of supporting browsers below).
trans-unit.target: 箭头功能是ECMAscript 6规范的一部分。尚未在所有浏览器中都支持它们，但是在Node v.4.0 +和截至2018年使用的大多数现代浏览器中都部分或完全支持它们。（我在下面提供了部分支持的浏览器列表）。

trans-unit.source: Arrow functions which is denoted by symbol (=>) helps you to create anonymous functions and methods. That leads to more shorter syntax. For example, below is a simple “Add” function which returns addition of two numbers.
trans-unit.target: <font style="vertical-align: inherit;"><font style="vertical-align: inherit;">用符号（=>）表示的箭头函数可帮助您创建匿名函数和方法。</font><font style="vertical-align: inherit;">这导致语法更短。</font><font style="vertical-align: inherit;">例如，下面是一个简单的“加”函数，该函数返回两个数字的加法。</font></font>

trans-unit.source: As all of the other answers have already said, it's part of ES2015 arrow function syntax. More specifically, it's not an operator, it's a punctuator token that separates the parameters from the body: ArrowFunction : ArrowParameters => ConciseBody. E.g. (params) => { /* body */ }.
trans-unit.target: 正如所有其他答案已经说过的那样，它是ES2015箭头函数语法的一部分。更具体地说，它不是运算符，而是将参数与主体分开的标点符号： ArrowFunction : ArrowParameters => ConciseBody 。例如 (params) => { /* body */ } 。

trans-unit.source: As others have said, it's a new syntax to create functions.
trans-unit.target: 正如其他人所说,这是一种新的函数创建语法。

trans-unit.source: As others have stated, regular (traditional) functions use this from the object that called the function, (e.g. a button that was clicked). Instead, arrow functions use this from the object that defines the function.
trans-unit.target: 如其他人所述，常规（传统）函数从调用该函数的对象（例如，单击的按钮）中使用 this 函数。相反，箭头函数从定义函数的对象中使用 this 。

trans-unit.source: Even though an ArrowFunction may contain references to super, the function object created in step 4 is not made into a method by performing MakeMethod. An ArrowFunction that references super is always contained within a non-ArrowFunction and the necessary state to implement super is accessible via the scope that is captured by the function object of the ArrowFunction.
trans-unit.target: 即使ArrowFunction可能包含对 super 的引用，也无法通过执行MakeMethod将第4步中创建的函数对象制成方法。引用 super 的ArrowFunction 始终包含在非ArrowFunction中，并且可以通过ArrowFunction的函数对象捕获的范围来访问实现 super 的必要状态。

trans-unit.source: Understanding that code requires an understanding of closures but the short version is bind makes a new function that always calls the original function with the this value that was bound to it. arrow function do the same thing since they are a shortcut for bind(this)
trans-unit.target: 理解该代码需要了解闭包，但简短的版本是 bind 产生了一个新函数，该函数始终使用绑定 this 函数的this值调用原始函数。箭头函数执行相同的操作，因为它们是 bind(this) 的快捷方式

trans-unit.source: What It Is
trans-unit.target: 它是什么

trans-unit.source: What this means in simpler terms is that the arrow function retains the this value from its context and does not have its own this. A traditional function may bind its own this value, depending on how it is defined and called. This can require lots of gymnastics like self = this;, etc., to access or manipulate this from one function inside another function. For more info on this topic, see the explanation and examples in the Mozilla documentation.
trans-unit.target: 用简单的术语来说，这意味着arrow函数从其上下文保留了 this 值，而没有自己的 this 。传统函数可以绑定自己的 this 值，具体取决于如何定义和调用它。这可能需要很多体操，例如 self = this; 等，以从另一个功能中的一个功能访问或操作 this 功能。有关此主题的更多信息，请参见Mozilla文档中的解释和示例。

trans-unit.source: What's the meaning of “=>” (an arrow formed from equals & greater than) in JavaScript
trans-unit.target: <font style="vertical-align: inherit;"><font style="vertical-align: inherit;">JavaScript中“ =>”（等于或大于的箭头）的含义是什么</font></font>

trans-unit.target: 如果只有一个参数，则可以省略参数周围的方括号 () 。

trans-unit.target: 您可以从上面省略 {} 。

trans-unit.source: You can see all the things that got shortened. We didn't need function, nor return nor .bind(this) nor even braces or parentheses
trans-unit.target: 您可以看到所有缩短的内容。我们不需要 function ，也不需要 return ， .bind(this) 甚至不需要括号或括号。

trans-unit.source: You can set this directly using call or apply
trans-unit.target: 您可以设置 this 直接用 call 或 apply

trans-unit.source: You can use arrow functions in Node, but browser support is spotty.
trans-unit.target: 你可以在Node中使用箭头功能,但浏览器的支持比较少。
